intro: Gymnogramma vittiformis, commonly known as the stripe-leaf maidenhair fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Blechnaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, finely divided fronds that are often adorned with distinctive, parallel stripes along the veins. Native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, this plant thrives in humid, shaded environments. The fronds are typically bipinnate, with small, triangular pinnae that give it a feathery appearance. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its elegant foliage and ability to thrive in indoor conditions.
